title: I think it's great that Crit is becoming a purely late game stat but...
body: Late game hasn't really existed much at all this season, so it would be nice to see some more changes to push the game more in that direction. I like how baron was given more hp because people rushing it down at 20 minutes really made games snowball faster. Please continue to push us more into a longer game direction Riot. 15-20 min stomps suck.

replies.body: Late game never exists because bot lane has been popping off WAY too early due to jungler influence and Support Gold Value. If Crit becomes a lategame stat, we'll start to see late games happening again. The only problem with that is, Assassins just got Stormrazor. Better ban Rengar
Stormrazor got a pretty good change on the PBE to prevent nuclear bursting. Now it's just flat damage rather than Rengar's or Zed's multiplicatively increased total AD times 2.

stormrazor was a much needed change because rushing it first item was incredibly broken, especially with cait. You litterally just run up AA someone kite back wait to the timer to refresh, rince and repeat. You automatically did more damage then your opponent with little to no counterplay. The only way i found to beat it was to have a support that can all in you easy, but some assassins with it you die even quicker than before and when you die in less than .3 seconds from full HP with ninja tabis its not really fun

Funny how people complain so hard about Stormrazor's first version when Ashe used to have almost the same mechanic through her original passive, but people thought it was utter shit.

Not that I care, just an interesting observation of how times have changed...
She also couldn't attack anything, including minions, if she wanted to get passive stacks.
Also her passive didn’t come up after only 2.5 seconds

Cuz it went against her identity to be the permaslow adc.

They chose permaslow ashe over the hit and run ashe

> [{quoted}](name=Jbels,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-10T04:14:01.289+0000)
>
> Late game never exists because bot lane has been popping off WAY too early due to jungler influence and Support Gold Value. If Crit becomes a lategame stat, we'll start to see late games happening again. The only problem with that is, Assassins just got Stormrazor. Better ban Rengar

No, it'll be like it was before when crit scaled too slow.

Utility ADCs and champs who spike off 2 cheap items will become the meta.

Before, when crit was scaling way too slow, the meta was nothing but 1-2 item lethality users and utility ADCs.

I can see the On-hit ADCs being even stronger, and utility ADCs maybe coming back if it ends up like that season.  Why play something that takes 3 items to even become relevant when you can play one of the on-hit rageblade users who can spike at 2, and actually be useful before 30 minutes. Same with utility ADCs.

Why were you down voted for saying something that's so true you can just look at top tier picks at those seasons where crit was more expensive,they were all Utility adcs {{champion:22}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:429}} or Lethality {{champion:202}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:236}} since literally getting 1 item on them meant you could blow up an enemy adc,so why bother rushing crit

> [{quoted}](name=HàrrowR,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2018-05-10T15:06:08.450+0000)
>
> Why were you down voted for saying something that's so true you can just look at top tier picks at those seasons where crit was more expensive,they were all Utility adcs {{champion:22}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:429}} or Lethality {{champion:202}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:236}} since literally getting 1 item on them meant you could blow up an enemy adc,so why bother rushing crit

Because people either didn't play then, or they didnt realize it, or they just flat out hate ADCs. Even when ADCs are weak, even if its a damn Ashe, if someone dies to an ADC kiting them out they will come to this forum and whine about it. They will run at the adc, probably waste their gap closer getting there, get kited out late game, come straight to the forums to cry about how easy right clicking is. Thats just what people here do.
Truer words have never been spoken

> [{quoted}](name=Jbels,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-05-10T04:14:01.289+0000)
>
> Late game never exists because bot lane has been popping off WAY too early due to jungler influence and Support Gold Value. If Crit becomes a lategame stat, we'll start to see late games happening again. The only problem with that is, Assassins just got Stormrazor. Better ban Rengar

Stormrazor got changed, It's definitely NOT a general Assassin item anymore.

It's more tailored to Marksmen.


EDIT: OK maybe Rengar and possibly Shaco might value it. No one else tbh



Stormrazor
[New item in testing with Marksman/AD item changes!]
AD increased from 55 to 65

Unique Passive effects changed:

"UNIQUE Passive - Storm's Edge: 
If you haven't attacked for 2 seconds, your next basic attack deals +50 damage (increased by your attack speed). 

UNIQUE Passive: 
When you apply Storm's Edge or critically strike, gain 8% attack speed for 5 seconds, stacking up to 5 times."




> [{quoted}](name=Thefrostyviking,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=00020000000000010000,timestamp=2018-05-10T21:35:54.108+0000)
>
> Indeed, a lot of people like to ignore diversity within a role and just state something that seemingly implies that all champs in the role are the same and anything that breaks past the norm of say a tank being able to soak damage and CC is OP or overloaded.
> 
> I´d personally find this game quite boring if all champs in a class were essentially the same but with different themes and nothing more x)
> 
> 
> And while on the topic of role diversity, some  marksmen actually prefer the early or even the midgame over the lategame, but that does of course not mean that their late is weak, its just not as good as the truly dedicated ones like kog.
> 
> If they snowball it will still feel like a lategame champ got ridiculously powerful even early, Lucian is a perfect example of this.
> 
> 
> And while i do find it annoying that some people seem to think that things like Ashe≈MF≈kog≈vayne etc i still think that there needs to be a basic floor at times......for otherwise the disparity in performance will just be too great.
> 
> For instance, there is basically no comparing a MF vs a Varus/kog in terms of tank killing ability even at 3-4 items.
> 
> Kog/varus will melt the tank in about 7 seconds, MF will at need anywhere between 30-50 seconds to do the same if they dont facetank her entire ulti.
> 
> Ashe would at 3-4 items need about 20-40 seconds depending on which tank.
> 
> 
> Such large gaps in performance are also in a way harmful when looking for diverse picks.....but at the same time that difference is also what makes those picks diverse in the first place.
> 
> 
> Diversity is a difficult thing at times i think x)


MF can rip tanks apart if she takes Conqueror.  She's one of the best ADC users of it next to Draven.
Stromrazor is viable on rengar anymore and prolly wont be if the current one goes out.

Well, late game might start existing if this happens tbh

Not really, because tanks are still broken beyond repair

This circle jerk need to die, tanks are the lowest performing class holistically at the moment.

Most of what you probably think are tanks, are not. 

What if I told you none of these are tanks?

Nah the guy doesn't have to build a lick of AP to do damage due to his high bases and health scalings and has health increases and CC in his kit.

Dudes a complete tank now with a not-so-viable off-meta AP build.

Yep that Mundo isn't a tank at all. He just absorbs more damage than nearly any other champion throughout a match. Definitely not the defining characteristic of a tank.

Yet he isn't a tank tho. No CC, no means to peel for allies, just a walking meatball that has great health regen and deals a good chunk of damage. 

That reminds me of someone who isn't a tank {{champion:86}}

> [{quoted}](name=Ryusaether,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=0000000100020000,timestamp=2018-05-10T16:56:25.279+0000)
>
> Yet he isn't a tank tho. No CC, no means to peel for allies, just a walking meatball that has great health regen and deals a good chunk of damage. 
> 
> That reminds me of someone who isn't a tank {{champion:86}}

Since when is having CC a requirement for being a tank?
And he does have peel. He has a decent ranged slow, enough AOE damage to threaten an entire team if they ignore him, and enough tankiness to require a whole team to take down. When he walks into the five man deathball, the enemy team has to choose between all of them receiving a steady tick of damage or wasting all their damage output on the tank for the next 3 seconds.
Not that i'm complaining. It's a tank's role to wade into the enemy formation and give his team time to pour on the damage.
I'm just saying that he has the tankiness to be considered a tank, and fulfills a tank's role for his team. That makes him a tank.

Yeah but he doesn't have any kind of displacement and his slow is simgle target and unreliable, while instead he has a lot of damage. Usual Tanks have tools to engage/disengage/displace enemies ({{champion:54}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:516}} etc.) or Utility in special cases {{champion:223}}.

Mundo is the definition of a freight train juggernaut ({{champion:2}} {{champion:102}}). I know he has some way to peel but it's nothing compared to a tank that can stunlock an enemy or a team, or even Darius would be a good peeler (death is the best CC).

I see your point, but I don't agree on the definition of Mundo as a Tank.

You are entirely right, he is a meat wall, a damage soak, but he definitely does not have the defining characteristics of a tank.

He does not have crowd control to peel for allies like a Warden, nor does he have ***ANY*** initiation tools to speak of, nor any form of lockdown as again, he has ***no*** CC beyond a minor single target slow, so he absolutely cannot be a vanguard.  Additionally, there is no way for him to generate aggro, nor a compelling reason for him to be focused before literally anyone else on his team.

> [{quoted}](name=PB4UAME,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=PiQ2l7HW,comment-id=0000000100020001,timestamp=2018-05-10T17:45:01.501+0000)
>
>   Additionally, there is no way for him to generate aggro, nor a compelling reason for him to be focused before literally anyone else on his team.

His damage is a very compelling reason for him to be focused 
You know, like the other juggernauts
If Cho'Gath isn't a tank, what is he?
A Juggernaut that can nuke a squishy and have some CC but no dmg threat other than his nuke, in exchange for more survivability.

RIOT considers him a "special plystyle" ala Singed.

Somewhere between juggernaut and battle mage.

By that same logic ADCs are weak,yet here we are 40 ADC hate threads a day talking about how strong they are and how much influence they have and how fast they come online.

I hate when people pull stats,especially winrates as a measure if something is broken or not,i mean Yas could have a win rate of 1% and i'd still ban him every game cause i don't want to face that toxic windwall

ADCs don't have competition though. They have their own role so if some of them are struggling, that means others have to be excelling. 99.9% of games have an adc on each team. This guarantes that one will win and one will lose every single game.

Tanks have a different story though. You can potentially have 3 or 4 tanks on one team and none on the other.  Tanks compete with fighters and mages in top lane, mages and enchanters in support, and assassins and fighters in jungle.  There is very rarely a tank in middle lane.

BUT TEH WINRATE REEEEEE

One of the issue´s causing "lategame" to feel like it doesnt happen is the fact that midgame was kinda skipped over.

Old times marksmen would have a phase between laning and the lategame where they either got kills and snowballed or got stagnant and struggled to accomplish much for a time.

With crit being a great deal more expensive and item reliant (you need more crit items) we effectively get a situation in which most marksmen wont snowball so hard so quickly even if they get kills early, just because they need that much more gold.

Which effectively fixes most of the crit snowball complaints i think.

What i am scared of however, is the so called early game transition builds.

Builds that start with {{item:3153}}  for instance, the item is getting  price buffs (as in getting cheaper)  and isnt far from being reverted to its 7,9 state when it was the go to item for almost all marksmen.

 It made them much stronger early/mid but a bit weaker post .....mid-mid game up to lategame where they became really strong again.


Then we have the big fish of {{item:3036}}  becoming total armor pen rather than bonus armor pen.

This will definitely cause a lot of issues related to {{champion:202}}  and {{champion:21}} , both can use lethality and LDR becoming total armor pen is essentially a pretty large buff towards those builds.

Anyone remember the god of forth? You better start praying now or by the time the 4th (shot) comes towards you it´ll be too late.



Well i am relatively fine with it all, i mainly play Ashe when botlane so i´ll get around^^

Why is yours,and apparently eveyone elses measure of late game how many crit items an ADC has,i mean when i play mid or jg i really couldn't care less how many items the enemy adc has,i mean if i play {{champion:103}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:104}} (keep in mind those are just the champs i play mid/jg) i feel like i can stomp pretty hard too,i mean most of the time i have the most damage when i play AP mid,if not then im second only to the adc and only by a few K damage,i focus on my own items and the game

Similar, but it's still different. When a tank begins to do above average damage, even if its only a little, EVERYONE shits on them with "NERF NERF NERF". Every time we try to defend our numbers with "we fall off though", it doesn't matter. When an adc begins to do more damage than they should be doing, watch somebody say something about it. Literally every ad main on the boards will swoop down and call your arguments bullshit, despite the fact that their champion IS currently overtuned. There might be two circlejerks, but both of them are against tanks and for adcs

When people are saying that  "tanks do too much damage" its usually the majority of them doing it, often by means of some items or simply a bunch of them getting buffed-


The reason many marksmen pop out when someone says "marksmen are overtuned"? Its because usually there are no more than 3-4 marksmen at a time who could be considered strong/OP.

But by saying marksmen OP they are basically saying that even the low key ones like Ashe are OP and doing too much damage, which in turn provokes in this case the Ashe players, like myself admittedly, out to come and complain x)

Then the ones who are bad with tanks like MF as well will come out and complain about that Sejuani/rammus never even getting close to dying.

Of course there are times when similar things  happen to the tanks with a few being OP but all of them being  called out for it.

Lack of specifications causes misunderstandings and a lot of circlejerking unfortunately :(

No, what I'm saying is that despite there being ADC circlejerks, they are nothing compared to the sheer hatred everyone seems to hold against tanks. Tanks wouldn't be allowed to be viable if the majority of the playerbase has its way

I honestly think its a problem when people start grouping a whole class that can contain 20 + champs under the same general guidelines,like how you said,people complain when Tanks deal damage but don't realize there's offensive and defensive tanks,yes,Ornn can deal a lot of damage in a teamfight while throwing CC everywhere,but he can't do what Shen does,he cant give your team mate a shield and teleport to him from anywhere on the map,he cant taunt that enemy to attack him and then block his attacks.

 Its the same with ADCs,they are at their BEST late game when they have six items due to how crit scales with other items,but that doesn't mean they should automatically be weak and useless early,i mean they still have a lot of disadvantages even late game,building full damage makes them the squishiest champ on the team,having no inbuilt resistances or shields (except Kaisa ) also doesn't help,along with the fact that they usually have some soft CC or no CC at all and that means that they are trading quite a few things for that damage and usually means they have to be protected in order to be useful,i think that's enough of a trade off,no need to make them useless until 70 minutes into the game.

Not to mention how many people argue that they shouldn't be mobile,shouldn't be able to 1v1,should instadie to anyone who catches them,shouldn't have access to lifesteal,and finally shouldn't have crit,it should be deleted,if this looks extreme to you then you're normal,cause i'm not making this up,i've seen a lot of people request a lot of these things and get up voted. 
Its like they don't understand that a class of over 20 champs needs diversity,not every ADC should look and play exactly like Kog Maw,a turret adc that needs to be protected by 4 people in order not to die and deal damage,some are duelist,some are artillery mage/adc hybrids,some are even assassin hybrids,some are AD casters etc.
Every one of them has a distinct advantage/disadvantage,i mean Vayne has a good 1v1 and mobility but if your team protects your ADC perfectly then i see no reason to pick her over Varus that can also root an entire enemy team basically while also poking and bursting down people with his abilities and making picks with his ult

> I honestly think its a problem when people start grouping a whole class that can contain 20 + champs under the same general guidelines,like how you said,people complain when Tanks deal damage but don't realize there's offensive and defensive tanks,yes,Ornn can deal a lot of damage in a teamfight while throwing CC everywhere,but he can't do what Shen does,he cant give your team mate a shield and teleport to him from anywhere on the map,he cant taunt that enemy to attack him and then block his attacks.

Indeed, a lot of people like to ignore diversity within a role and just state something that seemingly implies that all champs in the role are the same and anything that breaks past the norm of say a tank being able to soak damage and CC is OP or overloaded.

I´d personally find this game quite boring if all champs in a class were essentially the same but with different themes and nothing more x)


And while on the topic of role diversity, some  marksmen actually prefer the early or even the midgame over the lategame, but that does of course not mean that their late is weak, its just not as good as the truly dedicated ones like kog.

If they snowball it will still feel like a lategame champ got ridiculously powerful even early, Lucian is a perfect example of this.


And while i do find it annoying that some people seem to think that things like Ashe≈MF≈kog≈vayne etc i still think that there needs to be a basic floor at times......for otherwise the disparity in performance will just be too great.

For instance, there is basically no comparing a MF vs a Varus/kog in terms of tank killing ability even at 3-4 items.

Kog/varus will melt the tank in about 7 seconds, MF will at need anywhere between 30-50 seconds to do the same if they dont facetank her entire ulti.

Ashe would at 3-4 items need about 20-40 seconds depending on which tank.


Such large gaps in performance are also in a way harmful when looking for diverse picks.....but at the same time that difference is also what makes those picks diverse in the first place.


Diversity is a difficult thing at times i think x)
